search_results.title: 2025 Global Macro Strategy Outlook: The Order of Operations
search_results.text:
M Global Foundation
2025 Global Macro Strategy Outlook
The Order of Operations
In 2025, macro markets focus on an order of operations different 
to the one most learned in school: that of the incoming US 
government's actions along three policy axes: fiscal, immigration, 
and trade. A dovish skew to G10 central bank policy rates colors 
our view for lower G10 rates and a lower DXY.
Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC

search_results.title: 1H 2025 FX and Rates Outlook
search_results.text:
1H 2025 FX and Rates Outlook
6 December 2024
Global Markets Research and Strategy
Frances Cheung 
FrancesCheung@ocbc.com
Christopher Wong 
ChristopherWong@ocbc.com
Summary of Rates Market Views:
2
Central bank policy outlook:
• We expect a 25bp Fed funds rate cut in December and 100bps of cuts in 2025; risk to our base-case is the Fed may only be able to deliver fewer cuts or may have to pause earlier.
Our base-case for BoE is one 25bp Bank Rate cut in each quarter in 2025; risk is budget-induced inflation ends up higher than expected. We expect ECB to deliver 100bps of rate
cuts between now and end-2025; risk is for more or quicker rate cuts. RBA has continued to lag in terms of easing but may finally start cutting rates some time in 2025. We expect
four 15bp BoJ policy rate hikes between now and end-2025. Monetary policy outlook in Asia appears mixed, but a few Asian central banks are likely to be able to ease.
Markets:
• Short-end rates are likely to move lower in 1H2025 in most of

metadata.title: What will be the ending value of the UST 10Y Yield for these biweekly periods of Q4 2025? (Nov 10 - Nov 21)
metadata.description:
The 10-Year Treasury yield is the benchmark interest rate for U.S. government bonds with a ten-year maturity, widely followed as a barometer of financial market expectations for economic growth, inflation, and monetary policy.

The yield reflects market expectations for economic growth, inflation, and the future path of Federal Reserve policy. Tracking the biweekly closing value enables forecasters to gauge shifts in investor sentiment and macroeconomic outlook.

FRED series: [Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/DGS10 "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity")

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40046,"question_id":40014}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Nov 10 - Nov 21'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the last available daily value of the U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity published on the [FRED website](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/DGS10) for the final calendar day (typically the final Friday) of the corresponding biweekly period.
metadata.fine_print:
* If the FRED data is delayed, the value will be taken as soon as published for the relevant date.
* If the market is closed on the scheduled ending date or if no value for that date is published by FRED for two weeks, the most recent available value from an earlier day in the period will be used.
* Only the initially published value for each date will be used (no revisions).
* The value is reported in percentage points.
